Package shaharas

Class AddOneRight

java.lang.Object
shaharas.BaseOperators
shaharas.BaseUnaryOperators
shaharas.AddOneRight
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operators
public class AddOneRight extends BaseUnaryOperators
The AddOneRight class represents the post-increment operator (`variable++`). It extends the BaseUnaryOperators class and provides the functionality to increment a variable's value after returning its original value. This is typically used in expressions like `i++`, where the variable's value is first used in the expression and then incremented.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AddOneRight(HashMap<String,VariableEXP> variables)
    Constructor that initializes the operator with a right operand value of 0, the operator pattern to match `++` (post-increment), the operator symbol `++`, and assigns a priority level of `MORE_2_PRIORITY`.
    AddOneRight(AddOneRight a)
    Copy constructor that creates a new AddOneRight instance by copying the state of the given AddOneRight object.

  • Constructor Details

    • AddOneRight

      public AddOneRight(HashMap<String,VariableEXP> variables)
      Constructor that initializes the operator with a right operand value of 0, the operator pattern to match `++` (post-increment), the operator symbol `++`, and assigns a priority level of `MORE_2_PRIORITY`. It also initializes the variables map.
      Parameters:
      variables - A map of variable names to their corresponding VariableEXP objects.

    • setA

      public Operators setA(int a)
      Sets the left operand (`a`) for the post-increment operation. This operation doesn't require a left operand (`a`), so this method simply returns `this` without making any changes.
      Specified by:
      setA in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      setA in class BaseUnaryOperators
      Parameters:
      a - The value to be set as the left operand (not used in this case).
      Returns:
      The current AddOneRight operator (this).

    • calculate

      public int calculate(String variable, int... args)
      Performs the post-increment operation, which first returns the current value of the specified variable and then increments it. For example, `i++` returns the value of `i` and then increments it.
      Specified by:
      calculate in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      calculate in class BaseUnaryOperators
      Parameters:
      variable - The name of the variable to be incremented.
      args - Additional arguments (not used in this case).
      Returns:
      The original value of the variable before it was incremented.
